intro.title: What disturbs your sleep cycle?
intro.subtitle: Drag each disruptor to the sleep stage it affects most:

disruptors.title: Screen blue light
disruptors.explanation: Blue light from screens suppresses melatonin production, making it harder to fall asleep initially.

disruptors.title: Stress & anxiety
disruptors.explanation: Stress and anxiety can significantly reduce REM sleep, disrupting emotional processing.

disruptors.title: Late caffeine
disruptors.explanation: Caffeine consumed in the afternoon can prevent you from reaching deeper stages of sleep.

disruptors.title: Irregular schedule
disruptors.explanation: Changing sleep schedules disrupt your body's ability to enter deep sleep at the right times.

disruptors.title: Exercising late
disruptors.explanation: Late exercise raises your body temperature and heart rate, making it harder to enter deep sleep.

disruptors.title: Alcohol before bed
disruptors.explanation: Alcohol might help you fall asleep faster, but it severely reduces REM sleep, leaving you feeling mentally foggy even after 8 hours in bed!
